entry.title: Sample Gateway Project
entry.content:
[Table of Contents]

  • Create new project in Gateway Builder
  • Import DDIC Structure
  • Generate Runtime Objects
  • Register and Test the OData service
  • Provision the GET_ENTITYSET method
  • Add support for $filter to your code
  • Add support for additional query options to your code
  • Provision the GET_ENTITY method
  • Add an additional entity set for Sales Order Items

Create new project in Gateway Builder

Open transaction SEGW and click create to create a new gateway project

Click on the Create Project button

Create new project with name ZTEST_SEPM_ISOE

Import DDIC Structure

Import DDIC Structure SEPM_ISOE

Generate Runtime Objects

Press the Generate Runtime Objects to generate runtime objects

Register and Test the OData service

Expand the node Service Maintenance and right-click on GW_HUB and select Register

In the navigation tree right-click on GW_HUB and select SAP Gateway Client.Alternatively click on the SAP Gateway Client button in the detail section

This opens up the SAP Gateway Client in a new screen. The URI of the service document is already defaulted(/sap/opu/odata/SAP/ZTEST_SEPM_ISOE_SRV/?$format=xml). Press the Execute button

Press the Button “Entity Sets” and select SalesOrderSet

After pressing Execute button, you see an error message that indicates that the method SALESORDERSET_GET_ENTITYSET has not yet been implemented

Provision the GET_ENTITYSET method

Expand the node Service Implementation and expand SalesOrderSet.Now right-click on GetEntitySet(Query) and choose Go to ABAP Workbench

Switch to edit mode, scroll down to the method SALESORDERSET_GET_ENTITYSET and make sure to select it.Click on the Redefine Method button

Copy the entire coding shown below into the salesorderset_get_entityset method

Click on Activate. Navigate back to the Service Builder main screen. In the navigation tree right-click on GW_HUB and select SAP Gateway Client.Press the Button “Entity Sets” and select SalesOrderSet

You can retrieve the number of sales orders by adding /$count to the request URI

Add support for $filter to your code

Expand the node Service Implementation and SalesOrderSet and choose the entry GetEntitySet (Query). Switch to the change mode and replace the code with the code shown below.The code retrieves the $filter statement as an osql statement for the where clause. The data is retrieved and inserted into the return table et_entityset

Open up the SAP Gateway Client, and replace the URI as below. Further execute /sap/opu/odata/SAP/ZTEST_SEPM_ISOE_SRV/SalesOrderSet?$filter=Grossamountintransaccurrency ge 100000&$select=Salesorder,Grossamountintransaccurrency,Transactioncurrency&$format=json

Add support for additional query options to your code

Replace the code with the code shown below. The code retrieves the values for $top and $skip and the $filter statement as an osql statement for the where clause.The data is retrieved and in the end it is checked whether $inlinecount is used (which is a default for SAPUI5)

Open up the SAP Gateway Client, and replace the URI as below. Further execute /sap/opu/odata/SAP/ZTEST_SEPM_ISOE_SRV/SalesOrderSet?$filter=Grossamountintransaccurrency ge 100000&$select=Salesorder,Grossamountintransaccurrency,Transactioncurrency&$top=2&$skip=1&$inlinecount=allpages&$format=json

Provision the GET_ENTITY method

Expand the node Service Implementation and SalesOrderSet and choose the entry GetEntity (Read)

Switch to edit mode, scroll down to the method SALESORDERSET_GET_ENTITY and make sure to select it.Click on the Redefine Method button

Add the following code to the method.

Click on Activate. In the navigation tree right-click on GW_HUB and select SAP Gateway Client and use the following URL /sap/opu/odata/SAP/ZTEST_SEPM_ISOE_SRV/SalesOrderSet('500000034')​

Add an additional entity set for Sales Order Items

Open the Service Builder Project again. We will now create a second entity type for sales order items and entity set.Right-click again on Data Model and select Import –> DDIC Structure. Use the abap structure SEPM_ISOIE

Add an association and navigation properties

Expand Data Model and Right-click on Association and select Create

Provision the GET_ENTITY_SET method of the entity set SalesOrderItemSet

Replace with the following code

In the navigation tree right-click on GW_HUB and select SAP Gateway Client. Enter the following URI /sap/opu/odata/SAP/ZTEST_SEPM_ISOE_SRV/SalesOrderSet('500000034')/ToItems
entry.summary: Document [Table of Contents] Create new project in Gateway Builder Import DDIC Structure Generate Runtime Objects Register and Test the OData service Provision the GET_ENTITYSET method Add support for $filter to your code Add support for additional query options to your code Provision the GET_ENTITY method Add an additional entity set for Sales Order Items Create new project in Gateway Builder Open transaction SEGW and click create to create a new gateway project Click on the Create Project button Create new project with name ZTEST_SEPM_ISOE Import DDIC Structure Import DDIC Structure SEPM_ISOE Generate Runtime Objects Press the Generate Runtime Objects to generate runtime objects Register and Test the OData service Expand the node Service Maintenance and right-click on GW_HUB and select Register In the navigation tree right-click on GW_HUB and select SAP Gateway Client.Alternatively click on the SAP Gateway Client button in the detail section This opens up the SAP Gateway Client in a new screen. The URI of the service document is already defaulted(/sap/opu/odata/SAP/ZTEST_SEPM_ISOE_SRV/?$format=xml). Press the Execute button Press the Button “Entity Sets” and select SalesOrderSet After pressing Execute button, you see an error message that indicates that the method SALESORDERSET_GET_ENTITYSET has not yet been implemented Provision the GET_ENTITYSET method Expand the node Service Implementation and expand SalesOrderSet.Now right-click on GetEntitySet(Query) and choose Go to ABAP Workbench Switch to edit mode, scroll down to the method SALESORDERSET_GET_ENTITYSET and make sure to select it.Click on the Redefine Method button Copy the entire coding shown below into the salesorderset_get_entityset method Click on Activate. Navigate back to the Service Builder main screen. In the navigation tree right-click on GW_HUB and select SAP Gateway Client.Press the Button “Entity Sets” and select SalesOrderSet You can retrieve the number of sales orders by adding /$count to the request URI Add support for $filter to your code Expand the node Service Implementation and SalesOrderSet and choose the entry GetEntitySet (Query). Switch to the change mode and replace the code with the code shown below.The code retrieves the $filter statement as an osql statement for the where clause. The data is retrieved and inserted into the return table et_entityset Open up the SAP Gateway Client, and replace the URI as below. Further execute /sap/opu/odata/SAP/ZTEST_SEPM_ISOE_SRV/SalesOrderSet?$filter=Grossamountintransaccurrency ge 100000&$select=Salesorder,Grossamountintransaccurrency,Transactioncurrency&$format=json

entry.title: Postman for gateway
entry.content:
• Using postman to query SAP Gateway
  • Storing environment variables
  • Blogs

Using postman to query SAP Gateway

Determine the HTTP Address of the server.

  • Open T-Code – SMICM – > in the menu Go To-> Service
  • Note the HTTP Port Name and Host name. Ping the host name in Command Prompt to get the IP address
  • Use the IP Address and port from above to query the gateway system

Storing environment variables

Blogs

# Blog Reference
1 Gateway – OData Post using Postman https://blogs.sap.com/2019/07/18/gateway-odata-post-using-postman/
2 Using Postman For OData / Netweaver Gateway Testing CRUD Methods https://blogs.sap.com/2020/03/27/using-postman-for-odata-netweaver-gateway-testing-crud-methods/
entry.summary: Document Using postman to query SAP Gateway Storing environment variables Blogs Using postman to query SAP Gateway Determine the HTTP Address of the server. Open T-Code – SMICM – > in the menu Go To-> Service Note the HTTP Port Name and Host name. Ping the host name in Command Prompt to get the IP address Use the IP Address and port from above to query the gateway system Storing environment variables Blogs # Blog Reference 1 Gateway – OData Post using Postman https://blogs.sap.com/2019/07/18/gateway-odata-post-using-postman/ 2 Using Postman For OData / Netweaver Gateway Testing CRUD Methods https://blogs.sap.com/2020/03/27/using-postman-for-odata-netweaver-gateway-testing-crud-methods/

entry.title: Hana Client Reference
entry.content:
[Table of Contents]

  • Download
  • Run Commands
  • Connect via HDBSQL
  • Check Status
  • Create User
  • New Schema
  • Change User
  • Store connection details in secure user store (hdbuserstore)

The SAP HANA client provides a set of utilities and drivers to connect to and query a SAP HANA database from multiple programming APIs, such as Node.js, Python or Java. For a complete list, see SAP HANA Client Interface Programming Reference.

Download

Download the client installer for your platform (Microsoft Windows, Linux, or Mac) from the SAP Development Tools website under the HANA tab and the SAP HANA Client 2.0 section

Start the graphical installer hdbsetup or use the command line installer hdbinst

After the installation process is completed, update your path environment variable so that the SAP HANA client programs such as hdbsql can be found on your path. On Microsoft Windows, click the Start icon and search for environment variables

Run Commands

Run the following command in a newly opened shell to verify the installation succeeded and the path is correct 

hdbsql -v

Connect via HDBSQL

Connect to either SAP HANA Cloud or SAP HANA, express edition using host, port, and credentials

The following is a connection example for the SAP HANA Cloud.

hdbsql -e -n <host name>:<port> -u <user> -p <password>

Check Status

To check status of connection type \s

Create User

Create a new user that will be used to read / write into the hana database tables.

CREATE USER USER1 PASSWORD Password1 no force_first_password_change SET USERGROUP DEFAULT;

To verify that the user was created, enter the following command

SELECT USER_NAME FROM USERS;

A schema with same name is also created

SELECT SCHEMA_NAME FROM SCHEMAS;

New Schema

Create a new schema and grant USER1 the ability to create new objects in it

CREATE SCHEMA mfdata; 
GRANT CREATE ANY ON SCHEMA mfdata TO USER1;

Change User

Connect as USER1 and notice that current user changes from DBADMIN or SYSTEM to USER1.

SELECT CURRENT_USER, CURRENT_SCHEMA FROM DUMMY; 
CONNECT USER1 PASSWORD Password1; 
SELECT CURRENT_USER, CURRENT_SCHEMA FROM DUMMY;

Store connection details in secure user store (hdbuserstore)

Remembering and entering IP addresses, ports, user IDs and passwords can be difficult. Secure User Store offers a convenient means of storing this information and making it available to the SAP HANA client interfaces

Type hdbuserstore to see a list of available commands such as Set, List and Delete

Connect with USER1 as the username

hdbsql -attemptencrypt -U User1UserKey

Connect to database from Node JS

To connect to the database via node.js use the following code inside the route

ABAP development via VSCode

For ABAP Development via VSCode refer to this link

Common transactions

# Functionality Transaction
1 SAP Gateway Service Builder SEGW
2 Open gateway client /N/IWFND/GW_CLIENT
3 Error Log /N/IWFND/ERROR_LOG

Common codes that can be used

Where clause for $filter operations

$top operations

$skip operations

Blogs

# Blog Reference
1 SAP Gateway deployment options in a nutshell https://blogs.sap.com/2013/05/27/sap-netweaver-gateway-deployment-options-in-a-nutshell/
2 SAP Gateway Deployment Options https://blogs.sap.com/2019/04/23/sap-gateway-deployment-options/
3 Quick Starter Configuration Guide – SAP Gateway https://blogs.sap.com/2013/05/14/quick-starter-configuration-guide-sap-gateway/
4 SAP Gateway Client – Tips and Tricks https://blogs.sap.com/2017/06/15/sap-gateway-client-tips-and-tricks/
5 Updated tasklist available for SAP Gateway service activation https://blogs.sap.com/2018/04/16/updated-tasklist-available-for-sap-gateway-service-activation/
6 Activate Available OData in SAP Gateway https://blogs.sap.com/2020/08/05/activate-available-odata-in-sap-gateway/
7 SAP Gateway Tracing and Error Checking https://blogs.sap.com/2020/08/07/sap-gateway-tracing-and-error-checking/
8 Get Full URL & Sample Payload from SAP Gateway https://blogs.sap.com/2020/08/04/get-full-url-sample-payload-from-sap-gateway/
9 Odata V4 Gateway https://blogs.sap.com/2020/02/13/implementation-of-sap-odata-v4/
10 Understanding SAP Performance Statistics for SAP Gateway service https://blogs.sap.com/2016/01/28/understanding-sap-performance-statistics-for-sap-netweaver-gateway-service/
11 How to add annotations to an OData service using code based implementation https://blogs.sap.com/2017/04/21/how-to-add-annotations-to-an-odata-service-using-code-based-implementation/
